marketNews.title: Decline in Car Sales Starting to Flatten
marketNews.content:
Car wholesales in Indonesia in May 2024 were recorded at 71,263 units, increasing by +46.5% MoM but decreasing by -13.3% YoY. Cumulatively over 5M24, car wholesales in Indonesia only reached 334,897 units (-21% YoY), fulfilling only 30.4% of the 2024 target set by Gaikindo at 1.1 million units.
In May 2024, Astra International recorded car wholesales of 40,876 units, up +54.1% MoM but down -12.5% YoY. This result brought ASII's sales over 5M24 to 187,446 units, down -19.1% YoY. The lower YoY drop in ASII's sales compared to its competitors—both in May 2024 and 5M24—caused ASII's market share to rise compared to last year. Based on its brands, Daihatsu was the mainstay of ASII's sales with a much more moderate decline compared to Toyota+Lexus.
Meanwhile, sales from ASII's competitors experienced a deeper decline, with total non-ASII brand sales in May 2024 reaching 30,387 units (+37.5% MoM, -14.4% YoY). Cumulatively, total non-ASII brand sales in 5M24 reached 147,451 units, down -23.3% YoY. Wuling experienced an increase in market share during 5M24, while Honda and Hyundai experienced declines throughout this year.
After the release of car wholesale sales data for the May 2024 period, Gaikindo still maintains the sales target at the level of 1.1 million units.
Key Takeaway
Although the car wholesale sales figures appear difficult to meet the target set by Gaikindo, we assess that signs of improvement are beginning to appear. This is reflected in the sales decline starting to flatten, from levels around -20% YoY in previous months to around -10% YoY in May 2024.
Therefore, monthly car wholesale sales need to be monitored by investors. Given that ASII's valuation is already at a low level (1-Year Forward P/E 6x, P/BV 0.85x), signals of further recovery in car sales have the potential to be responded to positively by market players.

marketNews.title: President Joko Widodo said the rupiah exchange rate around 16,200-16,300 per US dollar is still in a good position, and mentioned that all countries are experiencing currency exchange rate pressure against the US dollar.
marketNews.content: President Joko Widodo said that the rupiah exchange rate in the range of 16,200-16,300 per US dollar is still in a good position, and mentioned that all countries are experiencing currency exchange rate pressure against the US dollar. President Joko Widodo's comments contrast with the stance of the Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, who in April 2024 requested that State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN) postpone large dollar purchases to reduce pressure on rupiah depreciation. Since the beginning of the year, the rupiah has depreciated by -5.5% YTD to the level of 16,295 per US dollar as of Tuesday (11/6).

marketNews.title: Head of the National Food Agency, Arief Prasetyo Adi, estimates that rice prices will increase in the next 2-3 months, in line with the decline in national rice production in 2H24.
marketNews.content: Head of the National Food Agency, Arief Prasetyo Adi, estimates that rice prices will increase in the next 2-3 months, in line with the decline in national rice production in 2H24. Arief also mentioned that rice prices could spike beyond the highest retail price (HET) set on June 5, 2024. Based on the sample framework area from BPS, rice production from January-July 2024 has experienced a deficit of up to 2.6 million tons.

marketNews.title: Head of the Capital Market, Derivative Finance, and Carbon Exchange Supervisory Authority of OJK, Inarno Djajadi, stated that there are 141 public offering pipelines with an indicative value estimate of IDR 56.92 trillion as of Monday (10/6).
marketNews.content: Head of the Capital Market, Derivative Finance, and Carbon Exchange Supervisory Authority of OJK, Inarno Djajadi, said that there are 141 public offering pipelines with an indicative value estimate of 56.92 trillion rupiah as of Monday (10/6). Of this amount, there are 81 prospective issuers queuing for IPOs with a total indicative value of 11.85 trillion rupiah.

marketNews.title: Head of the Capital Market, Derivative Finance, and Carbon Exchange Supervisory Authority of OJK, Inarno Djajadi, stated that the Special Monitoring Board policy with the full call auction (FCA) trading mechanism implemented on the IDX is a best practice for trading penny stocks.
marketNews.content: Head of the Capital Market, Derivative Finance, and Carbon Exchange Supervisory Authority of OJK, Inarno Djajadi, said that the Special Monitoring Board policy with the full call auction (FCA) trading mechanism implemented on the IDX is a best practice for trading penny stocks. Inarno mentioned that this best practice follows the New York Stock Exchange and has been studied since 2019. Inarno said that with the FCA mechanism, stocks that were previously stagnant at 50 rupiah per share can now be traded liquidly with a fairer price formation.

marketNews.title: OJK noted that the amount of public debt through online loans reached IDR 62.74 trillion as of April 2024, growing +24.16% YoY.
marketNews.content: OJK noted that the amount of public debt through online loans reached 62.74 trillion rupiah as of April 2024, growing +24.16% YoY. Head of the PVML Supervisory Authority of OJK, Agusman, said that the aggregate non-performing loan risk level or TWP 90 as of April 2024 is still under control at 2.79%, down from the March 2024 level of 2.94%.

marketNews.title: The Ministry of SOEs officially appointed former Finance Minister and Member of the National Campaign Team (TKN) Expert Council for Prabowo-Gibran, Fuad Bawazier, as President Commissioner at MIND ID.
marketNews.content: The Ministry of SOEs officially appointed former Finance Minister and Member of the National Campaign Team (TKN) Expert Council for Prabowo-Gibran, Fuad Bawazier, as President Commissioner at MIND ID. In addition, the Ministry of SOEs also appointed the Deputy Chairperson of the PSI Supervisory Board and Deputy Chairperson of the Prabowo-Gibran TKN, Grace Natalie, as Commissioner at MIND ID.

tickerNews.title: INCO Shareholders Decide Against Distributing 2023 Dividends, Approve Rights Issue Execution Price of IDR 3,050.
tickerNews.content: INCO: Vale Indonesia shareholders decided not to distribute dividends for the 2023 fiscal year, considering the need for capital expenditure for ongoing projects. In addition, INCO shareholders also approved changes to the composition of the board of directors and commissioners for the period from the completion of the divestment transaction until the GMS in 2027. In a separate opportunity, INCO set the rights issue exercise price at 3,050 rupiah per share, indicating a maximum fund raise of 1.84 trillion rupiah. This rights issue is part of fulfilling the obligation of divestment of INCO shares owned by Vale Canada Limited, Sumitomo Metal Mining Co. Ltd., and Vale Japan Limited to MIND ID. Cum right in the regular market and negotiations on June 14, 2024.

tickerNews.title: Trans Power Marine Announces USD 32.5 Million Transaction Value for Acquiring 65% Stake in PT Bahtera Energi Samudra Tuah, related to Next Month's Rights Issue.
tickerNews.content: TPMA: Trans Power Marine announced that the transaction value for acquiring 65% of PT Bahtera Energi Samudra Tuah shares reaches 32.5 million US dollars or approximately 529.8 billion rupiah assuming an exchange rate of 16,300 per US dollar. The acquisition is part of a rights issue worth 406.5 billion rupiah that will take place next month. The acquisition will be purchased from PT Patin Resources, a 12.05% shareholder of TPMA and also a standby buyer in the rights issue. Besides the funds from the rights issue, TPMA will use loans and internal cash to finance this transaction. TPMA also announced the latest rights issue schedule, with cum right in the regular market and negotiations on June 20, 2024.

tickerNews.title: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi (CUAN) Subsidiary Increases Stake in Petrosea (PTRO) to 41.5% via Stock Purchase.
tickerNews.content: CUAN: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi through its subsidiary, PT Kreasi Jasa Persada (KJP), purchased 75.8 million (7.5%) shares of Petrosea (PTRO) at a price of 2,741 rupiah per share on June 7, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 207.9 billion rupiah. The shares were purchased from PTRO shareholder, PT Caraka Reksa Optima. After this transaction, KJP's ownership in PTRO increased from 34% to 41.5%.

tickerNews.title: Puradelta Lestari (DMAS) Shareholders Decide Against Final Dividend for 2023, Approve Board Composition Changes.
tickerNews.content: DMAS: Puradelta Lestari shareholders decided not to distribute a final dividend for the 2023 fiscal year. Previously, DMAS distributed an interim dividend of approximately 578.4 billion rupiah or 12 rupiah per share in December 2023. In addition, DMAS shareholders also agreed on changes to the composition of the board of directors and commissioners. Hermawan Wijaya officially resigned from his position as Director and was replaced by Monik William. Shareholders also approved the appointment of Hermawan Wijaya and Masayoshi Hirose as Deputy President Commissioners to replace Teky Mailoa and Takefumi Nishikawa who resigned.

tickerNews.title: Bank OCBC NISP (NISP) Announces Merger Plan with PT Bank Commonwealth (PTBC) Effective September 1, 2024.
tickerNews.content: NISP: Bank OCBC NISP announced a draft merger plan with PT Bank Commonwealth (PTBC). This merger plan occurs after NISP completed the acquisition of PTBC on May 1, 2024, and aligns with the company's strategic objective to strengthen its position in the retail and SME sectors. This plan will be discussed in the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on August 2, 2024, with the merger expected to be effective on September 1, 2024. The merger announcement between NISP and PTBC was announced in November 2023, when NISP signed the acquisition agreement for PTBC worth 2.2 trillion rupiah.
